snippet.textDisplay: The best fan remake I've played. I find the 2D Metroids to be some of the most replayabale games and I can't be happier that Metroid 2 got such a quality (and superior) remake to join Zero Mission, Super Metroid and Fusion. I honestly had no expectations when I downloaded this game, but I quickly realized that this wasn't just any fan remake. Everything seems to have gone through a Nintendo-like quality check, from the way Samus handles, the various gameplay elements, the secrets, bosses, the soundtrack. I was hesitating between this and my #1 for the top spot in 2016 but ended giving this #2 as it's a remake, but that should tell you how much I loved it. On a related note, I'm playing through Dark Souls 3 and I would probably put it right behind this game right now, it's unsurprisingly awesome.
snippet.textOriginal: The best fan remake I've played. I find the 2D Metroids to be some of the most replayabale games and I can't be happier that Metroid 2 got such a quality (and superior) remake to join Zero Mission, Super Metroid and Fusion. I honestly had no expectations when I downloaded this game, but I quickly realized that this wasn't just any fan remake. Everything seems to have gone through a Nintendo-like quality check, from the way Samus handles, the various gameplay elements, the secrets, bosses, the soundtrack. I was hesitating between this and my #1 for the top spot in 2016 but ended giving this #2 as it's a remake, but that should tell you how much I loved it. On a related note, I'm playing through Dark Souls 3 and I would probably put it right behind this game right now, it's unsurprisingly awesome.

snippet.textDisplay: Same here, was not expecting anything going in. It ended up being the most fun I've had in years. I couldn't stop playing it! I honestly felt like I was back in my childhood again, playing a whole new SNES Metroid game! It's amazing!
snippet.textOriginal: Same here, was not expecting anything going in. It ended up being the most fun I've had in years. I couldn't stop playing it! I honestly felt like I was back in my childhood again, playing a whole new SNES Metroid game! It's amazing!

snippet.textDisplay: Definitely a bummer about what happened... I want to say I followed it for about 4 or 5, but I'm glad it was finished :). Super excited to see what Doc has in store for his next project!
snippet.textOriginal: Definitely a bummer about what happened... I want to say I followed it for about 4 or 5, but I'm glad it was finished :). Super excited to see what Doc has in store for his next project!

snippet.textDisplay: It's sad to see what became of this game after following it for like... 6 years. Probably my third or fourth favorite Metroid game ever, thought, I can't believe how fun it's to play.
snippet.textOriginal: It's sad to see what became of this game after following it for like... 6 years. Probably my third or fourth favorite Metroid game ever, thought, I can't believe how fun it's to play.

snippet.textDisplay: Absolutely one of the best games to be made in the last year, and a great gift for Metroid's 25th anniversary. Even though it's just a fan remake that took years to complete, I can see the legacy left behind changing the future of the gaming industry.
snippet.textOriginal: Absolutely one of the best games to be made in the last year, and a great gift for Metroid's 25th anniversary. Even though it's just a fan remake that took years to complete, I can see the legacy left behind changing the future of the gaming industry.

snippet.textDisplay: I played this game after hearing about it from your first upload. It was super fun! Really great remake, could easily pass as a legitimate Nintendo-made game. The first song you uploaded (Hydro Station) was the best song in the game, but this was one of the better ones too.
